english: Take the tea to Mr. Artuk.

text: Var, Candar Bey'e haber et. Eşkıyanın peşinden gittiğimi bilsin.
english: Yes, call Mr. Candar, let him know I'm after the pimp.
You're the one who orders it, sir.

text: Nasıl kıydınız oğluma? Ne istediniz ondan?
english: How did you kill my son?

text: Allah'tan, Allah'tan umut kesilmez Halime Hatun.
english: I am not hopeless of God.
You're strong, you're going to be strong.
Don't feel sorry for these bastards.

text: Artuk Bey'im, İshak Bey'im, yardım edin!
english: My Lord Artuk, my Lord Isaac, help me!
You're as brave as they say, Ertuğrul.
He's in safe hands until I get what I want.
What do you want, without a seed?
A thousand gold, you'll be alone.

text: Onların kılına zarar verirsen derini yüzerim.
english: If you hurt their hair, I'll swim your skin.
If we knew where you kept the women, maybe...
We can't wait with our hands tied, sir.

text: Ben yarın sabah erkenden pazara gideceğim.
english: I'm going to the market early tomorrow morning.

text: Bu soysuz kimdir, nereye gizlenmiştir herkese soracağım.
english: I'll ask everyone who this bastard is, where he's hiding.

text: ...kızım için canını ortaya koydun Ertuğrul Bey.
english: ...you risked your life for my daughter, Mr. Ertuğrul.
I will never forget your kindness.
I'm not going to be able to do this.
If you'll excuse me, Mr. Ertuğrul.
May God help you, Mr. Ertuğrul.
I'm not going to be able to do this.
Because I don't want to be seen...
I wanted to talk to you inside.
Are you okay? What's going on?

text: Dediğin gibi Aslıhan'ı da, Halime'yi de kaçırmış.
english: As you said, he took both Aslihan and Halime.
He told Mr. Ertuğrul what he wanted.
If you don't come with a thousand gold...
He said I'd kill them both.

text: Ertuğrul'un bin altını olmadığına göre ya Alpleriyle vuruşmaya gidecek...
english: Since Ertuğrul doesn't have a thousand gold, he's going to fight the Alps...

text: ...ya da babam ona bin altını verecek.
english: ...or my father will give him a thousand gold.

text: Öyle ya da böyle Francisco'nun tuzağına düşecek.
english: One way or another, he'll fall for Francisco.

text: Francisco'nun adamları Haçlı Ordu'sunda savaşmış güçlü savaşçılar.
english: Francisco's men were mighty warriors who fought in the Crusades.
Ertuğrul's body will be released from there.
But we have a problem, sir.

text: Bir eşkıyadan başka ne beklenirdi ki?
english: What else could be expected of a bride?

text: Yalnız bana bak, bu işin ardında olduğumu öğrenirse gırtlağını keserim.
english: Just look at me, if he finds out I'm behind this, I'll cut his throat.
Don't worry, sir, he won't find out.
So why are you still worried?
You're not going to kill Ertuğrul or your brother.
I'm going to save my brother from him.
I'll tell you about it later.
Let's just take a little bit of a nap first.
I'd like to stay with you tonight.
I pray for our saints to be rid of them.

text: İki obanın onca acısına rağmen kadınların yine de çalışmaya geldiğini gördüm.
english: I saw women come to work despite the pain of both sides.

text: Ertuğrul Bey gördüğüm en dirayetli adam.
english: Mr. Ertuğrul is the most courageous man I've ever seen.

text: Pazara geldiği ilk gün anlamıştım bunu.
english: I knew that the first day he came on the market.
I need to tell you what I know.
I think I know who took them.

text: (Aliyar) Hatunlarımızın kaçırılmasının bununla ne ilgisi var?
english: (Aliyar) What does our women being kidnapped have to do with this?
The day the carpet was opened...

text: Halime'yle Aslıhan Hatun hakkında sorular sordu.
english: He asked questions about Halime and Aslihan Hatun.

text: Sonra korktum ve tezgâhıma geri döndüm.
english: Then I got scared and went back to my desk.
Where am I gonna find them?

text: Yanındaki haydutlardan biri dükkânıma gelir gider.
english: One of the bandits next to you comes to my store.

text: Aya Nikolas Kayalıklarını mesken tuttuklarını işittim.
english: I heard they're housing the Nicholas Rocks on the moon.

text: Yalnız beyim, bunları benim söylediğimi kimse işitmesin olur mu?
english: Lonesome gentleman, would you mind if no one heard me say this?
How'd it go during the day, sir?

text: Allah izin verirse iyi olacaktır inşallah.
english: I hope it's good if God allows it.
He opened his eyes, Mr. Candar.

text: Abdurrahman, Simon'un elleri bağlı bir kadın getirdiğini söyledi.
english: Abdurrahman said Simon brought a woman with his hands tied.
Go and see what he wants.

text: Ben barıştan, huzurdan yanayım Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I am for peace, for peace, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Benim pazarıma, senin obana ve ailene kastedeni öğrendim.
english: I found out what you mean by my market, your town, and your family.

text: Ve işte onu sana teslim ediyorum.
english: And here I am delivering him to you.
What did you want from my baby in the penthouse?
I'm going to take care of it.

text: Bana bak, ötecek olursan gebertirim seni!
english: Look at me, I'll kill you if you do it!
(Ural) If you don't sing, you'll get away with it.
Even if he's guilty in our ceremony...

text: ...hele de bir kadını yargılamadan zora koşmak...
english: ...and to run hard without judging a woman...
I couldn't hold back after all this.
Take the girl to her room.

text: Maria, bu iş birlikçiyi Francisco ile konuşurken görmüş.
english: Maria saw this cooper talking to Francisco.
Why did you wait so long, Simon?

text: Öğrendiğim anda gereğini yaptım Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I did as soon as I found out, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Siz Türkler gerçeği söylese bile bir Hristiyan'a inanmazsınız.
english: You Turks won't believe a Christian even if he tells you the truth.

text: Biz Türkler adam olana her daim inanırız.
english: We Turks always believe in what happens to men.

text: Umarım avuçlarına bıraktığım kuşu kaçırmazsın Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I hope you don't miss the bird I left in your arms, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Amanda'yı pazardan yaka paça götürürlerken gördüm, peşlerine düştüm.
english: I saw Amanda being taken from the marketplace, I followed them.
He took Ertuğrul inside to question him.
If he talks, I'll kill him.
I'm going to kill that infidel.
Who made this cocktail for our women...

text: Civarda dosttan çok düşmanınız olduğunu çocuklar dahi bilir Ertuğrul Bey.
english: Even the children know that you have more enemies than friends in the neighborhood, Mr. Ertuğrul.
Sir, the devil is not talking.

text: Düşmanımız çok, dostumuz azdır bu çakal ininde.
english: We have many enemies, few friends in this chameleon.
...you just name one of those enemies.

text: Ben, ben bildiklerimi anlattım Aliyar Bey'e.
english: I told Mr. Aliyar what I knew.

text: ...o soysuzun tasmasını kim tutar onu da bilirsin.
english: ...you know who's holding that bastard's belt.
Talk to me, you fucking asshole!

text: Bize bu işin ardında kim olduğunu söylemezsen...
english: If you don't tell us who's behind this...
You know you can't get out of here, right?

text: Türkmen Obası'nın hatunlarına saldırırsa kellesinin gideceğini bilir.
english: He knows if he attacks Turkmenmenmen's girls, he'll lose his head.
You asked me who I suspected, I said, sir.

text: Madem o soysuz böyle bir şey yaptı...
english: If that bastard did something like that...
Why would he bring you here?
It's Simon's sister Maria. She is a woman.
He said he saw Francisco at your desk.
Anyone who wants can come to my desk, sir.
I don't have a choice of clients.

text: Her tezgâhına gelenden eşkıya diye şüphelenir misin kadın?
english: Do you suspect a hostage from every desk you come to, woman?
I said it was Simon, sir.

text: Ne demeye seni teslim eder o vakit?
english: What would he turn you in to say?
I did you a favor, sir.

text: Hâlâ iyilik ettim der beyim. Gayrı konuşturma şu kadını.
english: I'm still saying I did you a favor, sir.

text: Bu işin ardında kim var söyleyecek.
english: He'll tell me who's behind this.
He meant my brother's life, let it go!
Take her to the cage tent.
You're the one who orders it, sir.

text: Öyle kafese kapatmakla konuşmaz bu yılan Ertuğrul Bey.
english: He doesn't talk about shutting it down like that, Mr. Ertuğrul.
What should I do, Mr. Candar?

text: Konuşmaz diye bir kadına işkence yapacak değiliz ya.
english: We're not torturing a woman for not talking.
I'll take care of his question myself.

text: Eğer bir şey öğrenirsem size bildiririm.
english: I'll let you know if I find out anything.
I hope you can figure out the language of this snake.
We're waiting for your good news, sir.

text: Yarın akşam oğlumun ve obalarımızın kadınlarının...
english: Tomorrow night, my son and the women of our villages...
...there's a wedding to thank him for his survival.
Oh, my God, Mr. Ertuğrul, my God.
We forget about it when it comes to business.

text: Bakalım Ural bu işten nasıl sıyrılacak.
english: Let's see how the Ural gets away with it.
The Urals and the Hutu were in a state of guilt.
You should have seen their faces.

text: İyi bir ziyafeti hak ettik ha Philip?
english: We deserved a good feast, didn't we, Philip?

text: (Simon) Çamurun içinde keçileriyle yaşayan çobanlar topraklarımızı ele geçirdi.
english: (Simon) Shepherds living in the grass with goats have taken our land.
They're running horses right under our noses.

text: Babası ölse ona bir tas su vermez.
english: He won't give her a cup of water if her father dies.

text: Ne demeye bize bu iyiliği yapar beyim?
english: What good is that doing us, sir?

text: Kadın bir tek bu konuda doğru der beyim.
english: She's the only one who's right about that, sir.

text: Şeytanın sevabına iş gördüğü nerede görülmüştür?
english: Where did he show up to work for the devil?
What's the point of this Simon, son?

text: Onun gayesinden ziyade bizim oyunumuz ne olacak?
english: What's our game, rather than his?

text: İt serbest kalırsa mutlaka sahibinin yanına gidecektir.
english: If the dog is released, he will go to his owner.
You thought you'd get rid of me so easily?
I told you what I know.

text: Ne vakit istersen o vakit konuş.
Beyimiz de, hatunlar da sağ salim geldi.
english: Both the gentleman and the girls arrived safely.

text: Keşke Tuğtekin Bey'imle Gökçe Hatun'u da kurtarabilseydim kardeş.
english: I wish I could save my Mr. Piglet and my Skycatcher.
I can't get that unfortunate day out of my mind.
I missed my master so much, brother.

text: Allah bu kutlu yolda bize de şahadeti nasip etsin.
english: May God be a witness to this blessed journey for us.

text: Akşama kalmaz bülbül ederim ben bunu.
english: I'll be calling it a night.
Sir, how can you believe this lineage?
I believe him because he's telling the truth.
You're gonna come to my store and get it...
Before I could figure out what else was going on...

text: Kendi üzerindeki şüpheleri dağıtmak için seni ele verdi.
english: He betrayed you to dispel his suspicions.
The Sultan of Halime will escort you.

text: Siz dürüst ve adil bir beysiniz.
english: You're a fair and honest gentleman.
The horse grows, the horse rests.
The boy grows, the horse rests.
(Candar) That's what I want you to be.

text: Vade dolup da bu yalan dünyadan göçüp gidende...
english: When the promise is fulfilled and he leaves this world of lies...

text: Bileyim ki oğullarım dirlik ve birlik içinde.
english: I know my sons are alive and united.
You keep your heart at ease, Dad.

text: Biz aldığımız her nefesi obamızın için veririz.
english: We give every breath we take for our village.
All we do is glorify our village.
...the seven-headed dragon, and I wouldn't believe it.
I saw it, I realized it.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'in de dediği gibi baba...

english: ...if I hadn't had a brother from the Urals...
...we couldn't save our friends from those hostages.

text: Emir Saadettin ile ne görüşürsün ki oğul?
english: What do you see with Emir Saadettin, son?
You ordered Saadett, the Dog Lords to...
...and will give you the land from here to Enghury.
I've known the commander for 30 years, I know.
We were together at the battle of Harput.

text: Onun hükmü Konya Sarayı'nın dehlizlerinde geçer.
english: His sentence will be carried out in the trenches of Konya Palace.
The big Pervane has wasted the Jelaleddin Karatay.
He hides his intent from himself, Emir.

text: Selçuklu'da Sultan'dan sonra gelen adamdan söz ederiz ağabey.
english: We're talking about the man who came after the Sultan in Selcuklu, brother.
I don't know what he's up to.

text: Ama Selçuklu bu topraklarda kök salmak istiyorsa...
english: But if Seljuk wants to take root in this land...
You have given the order, Your Honour...
What would he do without our support?

text: Var mıdır bizden daha fazla Alp'i olan oba?
english: Is there a village with more Alps than us?

text: Bu kudurmuş nehirde tutunacak bir dal ararız.
english: We'll find a branch to hold on to this damned river.
You have given the order, Your Honour...
I'm gonna blow that thing on Simon's head.
You're the one who orders it, sir.
First the dagger thing, now this.

text: İkimizden biri ölecek. Başka yolu yok.
english: One of us is going to die.
How are you gonna explain this to your dad?
I'll tell you that I found out that Simon killed the knocker.

text: Onu öldüren zehri Maria hazırladı. İspatı da o handa.
english: Maria prepared the poison that killed him, and the evidence was in that hole.

text: Ya o ölecek ya da ben.
english: Either he dies or I die.
I don't have time to waste.

text: Senin ve oğlumuzun hayatını borçlu olduğumuz...
english: We owe you and our son...
...you take care of our guest, Halime Sultan.
I'm so glad you made it.
I'm sorry, I didn't believe you.
Thanks to you, my son's life was saved.

text: Şifa çadırına bir gidelim, İshak yaralarınıza bir baksın.
english: Let's go to the healing tent, and let Isaac look at your wounds.

text: Bir an evvel gitsem daha iyi.
english: I'd better get going a minute early.

text: E atınız hazırlanana değin bir tas ayranımızı içseydiniz.
english: Why don't you drink a glass of our beer before your horse is ready?
Rock, take three Alps with you.
You're the one who orders it, sir.

text: Sen de pazara git. Turgut gelirse haber et.
english: You go to the market, and if Turgut comes, let me know.
I'll be aware of every move Amanda makes.
- Mr. Artuk - Mr. Artuk - There you go.
I'll talk to them before the wedding.
You're the one who orders it, sir.

text: Pusatım paslandı mı dersin ha yiğidim?
english: You think my butt is rusty, son?
...we've become the hand that squeezes the enemy's throat.
The fountain from which we do not drink...
...the land we never set foot in...
...we didn't leave a yard we didn't leave.
(Sighs) How hard it is to be a gentleman.

text: Atam Süleyman Şah'tan aldığım kutlu vazifenin...
english: Your blessed office, which I received from my father, Suleiman Shah...
The enemy's fit is at my fingertips.

text: Kılıcımı paslandıran bu fitneden sıkıldım Aktolgalı.
english: I'm sick of this sword-swearing conspiracy, Aktolgal.

text: Yiğitçe dövüşüp kılıcımla susturduğum düşmanımı bile arar oldum.
english: I have even fought valiantly and called my enemy whom I have silenced with my sword.
...will become a sword to take their captives.
He is the son of Sultan Sultan Ertuğrul.
...without asking for the account of these...
...he will not die before he serves his neck.
You come to the table, Bartalmay.

text: Bugün çok mutluyum. Hadi otur. Yemeğini bizimle ye.
Masanıza oturma şerefini neye borçluyum Üstat Simon?
english: To what do I owe the honor of sitting at your table, Master Simon?

text: Ertuğrul'un Çavdarlara açacağı savaşa borçluyuz Bartalmay.
english: We owe Ertuğrul the war he's going to open up to the Knights, Bartalmay.

text: Kayılar küçük bir oba olsa da...
english: Although the boats are a small village...

text: ...Ertuğrul'un Alpleri Çavdarlara karşı kolay boyun eğmez.
english: ...the Alps of Ertuğrul do not easily bow to the invaders.

text: Boyun eğmesini isteyen de kim Petrus?
english: And who is Peter, who wants to bow down?

text: Bırakalım birbirini yok edinceye kadar savaşsın iki oba.
english: Let's let them fight each other until they destroy each other.

text: Biz de iki obayla da ticaretimize devam edelim.
english: We'll continue to trade with both houses.
Amanda, you finally got a job.

text: Ticaret dediniz de müsaade ederseniz Üstat Simon...
english: You said trade, and if you'll excuse me, Master Simon...
I'm going to the market now.

text: (Samsa) Ertuğrul Bey'im Amanda denen hatunu serbest bıraktı.
english: My lord Ertuğrul has released his wife Amanda.

text: Kiminle ne iş yapar bilmek ister.
english: He wants to know who he's doing business with.
If he comes to the market and talks to someone...
He said to let me know.
He met an Alp from the records.
(Hasan) And he had a man behind him.

text: Turgut'u da Amanda'yı takip etmesi için görevlendirmiş.
english: Turgut was also assigned to track Amanda.

text: Demek odadan çıksa haberin olurdu ha?
english: So you'd know if he left the room?

text: Adam gözümüzün içine baka baka bizimle oyun oynadı.
english: He was playing with us, staring us in the eye.

text: Belki de koynu sana sıcak gelmiştir ha?
english: Maybe your neck is hot for you, huh?

text: Demek bizi tuzağa düşüren de oymuş.
english: So he's the one who set us up.

text: Lanet olsun! Turgut her şeyi biliyor.
Gizli geçidi, Saadettin Köpek'in bize gönderdiği mektubu...
english: The secret passage, the letter Saadettin Dog sent us...

text: Her şey yine alt üst oldu!
Ertuğrul hep bizden bir adım öndeydi.
english: Ertuğrul was always one step ahead of us.
So Turgut was the one who gave him this.

text: O hain yaşadıkça tehlikedeyiz Üstat Simon.
english: We are in danger as long as he is alive, Master Simon.

text: İzin verin, izin verin onun kalbini söküp size getireyim.
english: Let me, let me, let me rip his heart out and bring it to you.

text: Turgut bizim için son bir şey daha yapacak.
english: Turgut will do one last thing for us.
This guy's obviously waiting for someone.

text: Ne işin var senin burada, ha? Nasıl kaçtın?
english: What are you doing here, huh?
I didn't run away, he sent it himself.

text: Ahmak kadın, Ertuğrul seni yem olarak kullanmış.
english: You foolish woman, Ertuğrul used you as bait.

text: Bana geleceğini bilmese seni bırakır mıydı?
english: Would he leave you if he didn't know you were coming to me?

text: Hayır Ural. Simon'un işi olduğunu düşünüyor.
english: No, the Urals, they think Simon's the one doing it.
I'm not going to quit my job.

text: Ertuğrul bunun peşine adam takmıştır mutlaka.
english: I'm sure Ertoğrul has a guy behind it.
She must never know Amanda came to me.
Send your men out now, and let them look around.
We'll be back in the country soon.

text: İşleri bitti. Ölülerimizi bırakmayın. Acele edin.
english: Don't leave our dead, hurry up.
We'll be in the barn when it gets dark.

text: Oy, anası kurban olsun beşikte yatan kuzusuna.
english: Oh, the mother of the lamb in the barn.
My Lord has answered our prayer.
He has forgiven us my day.

text: O olmasa ne yapar anası bu dünyada?
english: What would her mother do in this world without her?
Open your mouth for good, Halime Sultan.

text: Ya sen olmazsan oğlun ne eder?
english: What would your son do without you?

text: Hiç ben ne yaparım dediğini işitmedim.
english: I never heard you say what I'd do.

text: Ne de olsa beyler ikinci hatunu almayı adet edinir oldu.
english: After all, gentlemen have become accustomed to taking the second shot.

text: Tutup da ben olmazsam başka hatun alırsın...
english: If you don't get me, you'll get another girl...
I don't know where he is anymore.

text: Lakin haline bakılırsa düşüncesi dahi hoşuna gider görünür.
english: But from the looks of it, you seem to like the idea.
Man escapes the sword of the frog and...
...can't get rid of the language of your memory.
You want to get a girl on top of me.

text: Ne de olsa civar obaların kızları peşindedir.
english: After all, the girls from the surrounding villages are after you.
If a no comes to the person...

text: Kan bağı ile bağlananları ancak toprak ayırır.
english: Only the soil separates those who are connected by blood.
We're not going to be able to...
...to bind her to never leave again.
(Aliyar) My sister Aslihan would like it too.
Marrying a man from the Soup Room.
I'm going to talk to Aslihan about this marriage.

text: Aslıhan bacımı kiminle evermeyi düşünürsün baba?
english: Who do you think you're gonna fuck with, Dad?
The one you call the boat is Ertuğrul.

text: İyi dersin de baba, Ertuğrul Bey zaten evli.
english: You're doing well, Dad, Mr. Ertuğrul is already married.
She's got a baby, don't you know?
He is the nephew of Sultan Alaeddin.
My sister, as a matter of fact...

text: ...ikinci eş olmayı kabul eder mi baba?
english: ...will he accept to be his second wife, Dad?

text: ...Ertuğrul Bey öyle sıradan bir adam değil ki.
english: ...Mr. Ertugrul is not such an ordinary man.

text: Söz de karar da senindir baba.
english: The word and the decision are yours, Dad.
...Yonder Bey is also the son of Suleiman Shah.
For the sake of the good...

text: Daha uzun yıllar Kayıların başında kalacaktır.
english: He'll be at the top of the boxes for years to come.
So we can tie the logs to our office...
We can't wait for Dundar to be a gentleman.
What does my brother in the Urals say?
It's no secret that they didn't get along with Mr. Ertuğrul.
This marriage is for the Ural...

text: ...hep peşinde olduğu büyüklüğü ve gücü kazandıracaktır.
english: ...and will gain the greatness and power that he is always after.
I have no doubt you will.

text: Umalım da Ural'a gidecek kadar ahmak olsun.
english: Let's hope he's stupid enough to go to the Urals.

text: Ertuğrul için önemli olan Amanda'nın kiminle buluştuğu.
english: What matters to Ertuğrul is who Amanda's meeting with.
Batuhan, you and your men lock the door.
They're the Alps of the Scaffold, Master Simon.
You're having your last meal, Simon.

text: Ne kadar da duygusal bir adamsın Ural.
Yine kimler ne söyledi de inandın, ha?
english: Who said what you believed, huh?

text: ...beni de onun önüne attığını mı sanırsın aklınca?
english: ...you think you threw me in front of him?

text: Amanda'yı Ertuğrul'a vererek seni onun önüne nasıl atacağım acaba, ha?
english: How am I supposed to throw you in front of him by giving Amanda to Ertuğrul?
I hope I didn't stop you from getting your throats kicked.
While you're trying to get each other's heads off...

text: ...Sultan Alaeddin buradan Engürü'ye kadar olan toprakların hakimiyetini...
english: ...Sultan Alaeddin has ruled the land from here to Engheri...
...who wants to give it to Ertugrul.

text: Karacahisar ve kalesi Bizans tekfurunun elindeyken mi?
english: When Karacahisar and his castle were in the hands of the Byzantine monarchy?

text: Sultanımız nasıl bir hata yaptığının farkında değildir.
english: Our Sultan is unaware of his mistake.

text: Tamam, gücüne, kuvvetine diyecek lafımız yoktur.
english: Okay, we have no words for your strength, your strength.

text: Ama dört yüz çadırla mı fethetmeyi düşünür Karacahisar'ı?
english: But is he planning to conquer Karacahisar with four hundred tents?
The smaller the stone, the larger the head.

text: Sen hep yanlış kararlar alır oldun Ural.
english: You've always made the wrong decisions, Ural.
...and try to be a master to your father.

text: Onun da zamanı gelecek Emir Hazretleri.
english: His time will come, Your Highness.
I'm not going to be the master of the Sculpture House...
Your time is nearer with this journey.
The Ural, who cannot rule even his own village...
...you'll do exactly what I tell you.
...and he'll blow his blood and his market on his head.
I've already written Ertuğrul's death warrant.
I thought Simon was the owner.
I don't want you to get hurt.
It's just a matter of giving a simple take.

text: -Alplere haber edildi mi Artuk Bey? -Hepsi emirlerini bekler beyim.
english: - Have the Alps been notified, Mr. Artuk?
My boy, my boy, my lion, my lion!

text: ...ve eşhedü enne Muhammeden abdühü ve resulühü.
english: ...and his wife, the abductee and apostle of Muhammad.

text: Kaya! Yiğidim! Kim yaptı sana bunu?
english: Rock, my boy, who did this to you?

text: Ural Bey çok fazla tehdit buyurup çok az iş yapar Emir Hazretleri.
english: Mr. Ural makes too many threats and does too little, Your Honor.

text: Ona kalsa şimdiye Ertuğrul'u defalarca öldürmüştü.
english: He's already killed Ertuğrul many times.

text: İnşallah senin de işin ona benzemez.
english: I hope you don't have the same job.

text: Konya'ya dönmezseniz yarın Ertuğrul'un ölüm haberini alırsınız.
english: If you do not return to Konya, you will receive news of Ertuğrul's death tomorrow.

text: Bir Türkmen beyinin ölümünü isteyecek halim yok.
english: I'm not in the mood to ask for the death of a Turkmen brain.

text: Lakin Azrail'e de kime uğrayacağını söyleyecek değiliz.
english: But we're not going to tell Azrail who to visit.

text: Ahalinin huzuru, zenginliği. Her emir ister ki...
english: The peace of the people, the prosperity of the people, every order demands...
...that his affairs may be corrupted by corruption and whimsy.

text: Uhulet ve suhuletle gebereceksin Ertuğrul Bey.
english: You will die with the whim and the whim, Mr. Ertuğrul.
(Simon) You are a whore, a whore.

text: Sultan'ın saraydaki casusu olanları acilen öğrenmeli.
english: The Sultan's spy at the palace must find out immediately.
You're going to give this letter to Alfonso, Philip.

text: Kaya Alp duyduklarının bedelini ödemiştir beyim.
english: The Rock Alps paid the price for what they heard, sir.

text: Amanda denilen hatun sahibini bulmuş olacak ki...
english: He must have found a girl named Amanda who owns...
...they didn't leave a witness behind them.

text: Allah olan bitene şahittir Artuk Bey.
english: God is witness to what is happening, Mr. Artuk.

text: Bu işin ardındaki akıl elbet pusatımla tanışacak.
english: The mind behind this will definitely meet my hubby.

text: Seni ne diye ünlettim merak edersin tabii.
english: You're wondering why I made you famous.
...the first day she gave you to me...
I think I'm being beaten like a cross.
...when I took you in my arms...
...that bird flies out of the nest.
The long and short of it, my dear girl...
...now flying out of your father's nest...
...it's time to make your own home.

text: Sen nasıl uygun görürsen öyle olur baba.
english: It's what you think is right, Dad.
...and you have the right not to marry.
I'll try to choose the best.

text: ...seni Kayıların Bey'i Ertuğrul Bey'le evermek isterim.
english: ...I'd like to fuck you with Mr. Ertuğrul, the Lord of the Rings.
...I was going to marry Mr. Ertugrul.

text: Peki, Aslıhan ne der bu karara?
english: So, what does Aslihan say about this decision?

text: Ertuğrul Bey gibi bir devlet kuşu konar başına.
english: A government bird like Mr. Ertuğrul is on the verge of extinction.
You made the right decision, Dad.
...the name is great of Mr. Ertuğrul.
...the decision of Ertugrul's support for us is not yet.

text: Ama bir dost fazla, bir düşman eksik.
english: But one friend too many, one enemy too few.
He flies with a herd of birds, the Urals.

text: Bize bir fayda varsa kendimizden var.
english: If we're going to get something, it's on our own.

text: Eğer kardeşinle evlenmeyi kabul ederse Ertuğrul Bey...
english: If he agrees to marry your brother, Mr. Ertuğrul...

text: Kutsal ışığı söndürmek isteyenlerin ölüm vakti geldi dostlarım.
english: The hour of death has come for those who seek to extinguish the holy light, my friends.

text: Ölümün soğuk nefesini almaya geldim sizden.
english: I'm here to take the cold breath of death from you.
Give me the breath of hell.
Listen to the children of Olympus.

text: Utanılacak bir şey yoktur Aslıhan. Evlilik her hatunun hayalidir.
english: There is nothing to be ashamed of, Aslihan.
Being the second chick is confusing.

text: Bana sorarsan aklın hiç karışmasın. Genç olan, taze olan sensin.
english: Don't get me wrong, you're the young, fresh one.
Let Halime Hatun think about it...

text: ...eri, genç ve güzel bir dilberle evlenince hali ne olacak.
english: ...when she marries a young, beautiful linguist.
The scumbag is in the hands of...

text: ...Halime Hatun'un nasıl savaşçı bir kadın olduğunu gördüm.
english: ...I saw how a warrior woman Halime Khatun was.

text: Beyine, oğluna nasıl bağlı olduğunu bilirim.
english: I know how attached you are to your master, your son.

text: Bir gün savaşır seninle, iki gün savaşır...
english: One day he'll fight you, two days he'll fight you...

text: Ertuğrul Bey bu işe he derse Halime Hatun da kabullenecektir.
english: If Mr. Ertuğrul teaches you this, Halime Hatun will be accepted.
Would you accept it, little man?

text: Sen kabul ettikten sonra bugün he demese yarın he diyecek.
english: After you accept, he'll say yes today, not yes tomorrow.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'e karşı gelecek değil ya.
english: He's not going to fight Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Esirgeyen ve bağışlayan...

english: ...in the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Gerçekten onlar çeşitli hileler ve tuzaklar kurdular.
english: They have indeed devised a plan.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Allah katında da onlara hilelerine karşı azap var.
english: And with Allah is a punishment for their scheming.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) İsterse onların hileleri dağları yerinden oynatacak olsun.
english: Their plan may move the mountains if He wills.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Hani bir vakitler o kafirler seni tutup bağlamak...
english: (O Prophet), when the disbelievers seized you with chains,

text: ...veya öldürmek veya sürüp çıkarmak için sana tuzak kuruyorlardı da...
english: ...or they set you up to kill you or drive you out...

text: ...onlar tuzak kurarken Allah da karşılığında tuzak kuruyordu.
english: ...when they set up a trap, God set up a trap.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Öyle ya, Allah tuzakların en hayırlısını kurar.
english: But Allah is the best of planners.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Onlar hileye başvurdular.
(İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Allah da onların tuzağını boşa çıkardı.
english: But Allah has made their plot to fail.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Allah hileleri boşa çıkaranların en hayırlısıdır.
english: Allah is the best of the planners.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Ondan başka her şeyden uzağım.
english: (Ibn-i-Arab's external voice) I am far from anything except him.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Artık hepiniz toplanın, bana istediğiniz tuzağı kurun.
english: So gather yourselves together, all of you, and plot against me what you will.

text: (İbn-i Arabi dış ses) Sonra hiç bekletmeyin.
Azim olan Allah ne güzel, ne doğru söyledi.
english: How good and how true is God, the Mighty One, in His words.

text: Allah'ım sen aslanlarına, yiğitlerine kurulan tuzakları boz.
english: My God, destroy the snares of the lions and their mighty men.
I'm going to be a little late.
For the soul of our martyrs.
The brave sons of the Caia.
...we buried it in the dark ground.
The rock is the Alpine martyr.

text: Davamız kutlu, yolumuz çetin, düşmanımız kahpedir.
english: Our cause is blessed, our way is hard, our enemy is a fool.

text: İnşallah bir gün bizim de gireceğimiz gibi.
english: I hope one day we'll get in.
Just like my father's son came in.
Just like Mr. Call came in.
Just like my father, Suleiman Shah, came in.

text: Onlar, güneşin doğuşunu selamlayarak gittiler gaza yoluna.
english: They went to the gas station greeting the sunrise.

text: Bastıkları her karış toprakta iz, arkalarında bir yurt...
english: Every inch of their soil is a trail, a home behind them.
...and they've left a blessed case for the future.
Who made this land a land of honor...

text: Vakit bu kirli toprakları, şehitlerimizin kanıyla şerefli kılma vaktidir.
english: It's time to honor this filthy land with the blood of our martyrs.

text: Ve bu sadakat Ertuğrul'un ölümünü getirecek.
english: And this loyalty will lead to Ertuğrul's death.

text: Biz de bu uğurda değerli bir kardeşimizi kaybedeceğiz.
english: We're going to lose a dear brother for this.
But God will reward Alfonso with his heaven.

text: Civar obaları dolaşıp çoktandır görmediğim Alpleri ziyaret etmek isterim.
english: I'd like to walk around the surrounding villages and visit the Alps I haven't seen in a long time.

text: Et tabii. At sırtında dolaşmaya alışıksın.

english: I'll be back in the morning, and you'll tell Simon.
May the Holy Spirit protect you, Alfonso.

text: Baksana Aslıhan'a beyim, nasıl da tedirgindir.
english: Look at Mr. Aslihan, how nervous he is.

text: Belli, gönlü var ama Halime Hatun'dan çekinir.
english: He's got a heart, obviously, but he's afraid of Halime Hatun.
This is going to be discussed at the wedding tonight.
My father will reveal his intention to Ertuğrul.

text: Ama Ertuğrul bunun cevabını verecek kadar uzun yaşar mı orasını bilmem.
english: But I don't know if Ertuğrul will live long enough to answer that.
He'll lose his lover before he can melt it down.

text: Hatta Ertuğrul'un ölümü Toktamış'ınkinden de acı olacak.
english: In fact, Ertuğrul's death will be more painful than that of Toktamış.
The Eagle will find what he deserves.

text: Senin ne işin var burada Turgut?
english: What are you doing here, Turgut?
Simon sent me over to you.

text: Bu mektubu ancak bir şövalye taşıyabilir.
english: Only a knight can carry this letter.

text: Simon sana böyle bir görev vermez.
english: Simon doesn't give you a job like that.

text: Bir kapısı önde, bir kapısı da yanda, ahır tarafında.
english: One door in front, one door on the side, the other side of the barn.

text: Kapıdakiler ve içeridekilerle birlikte en az otuz, kırk kişiler.
english: At least 30 or 40 people with the door and the inside.
Sir, we'll count your numbers before you fall asleep.

text: En ufak bir gevşeklik çıkarsa hesap senindir Bamsı.
english: If there's any looseness, you're responsible, Bams.

text: Beyim, biz o hesabı canımızla öderiz beyim.
english: Sir, we'll pay that bill with our lives, sir.

text: Senin uğruna canımız da, kanımız da fedadır beyim.
english: Our lives and blood are sacrificed for you, sir.

text: Lakin bana da, kayıya da ölecek değil, yaşayacak Alp lazımdır.
english: But I need the Alps to live, not die.
Right here at the end of the road...
The archers will be positioned on either side.

text: Emrim olmadan kimse ama hiç kimse mevziisinden ayrılmayacak.
english: No one, but no one, will leave his position without my order.
I want Simon to be alive.
We have a lot to learn from him.

text: İnşallah Gündüz Bey'in sancağının altında da cenk etmek nasip olur bize.
english: I hope we will have the chance to fight under the banner of Mr. Sunshine.

text: Kardeş, şimdi bile çıksa senden iyi kılıç sallar.
english: Brother, if he comes out now, he'll swallow better than you.
Do you think it's true, Doğan?
Whatever you say is true, sir.

text: Gündüz'ümün beylik çağına kadar bir obamız kalacaksa...
english: If we can have a village until the day I'm a gentleman...

text: Bastığımız toprakları yılandan, çıyandan, çakaldan, domuzdan temizleyeceğiz ki...
english: We're going to clear the land of snakes, sand, lizards, pigs...
...the sword of my sun shall make our land clay.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Var olsun beyimiz, daim olsun neslimiz.
english: (Everyone's mouths) May there be our lord, may there be our generation forever.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Var olsun beyimiz, daim olsun neslimiz.
english: (Everyone's mouths) May there be our lord, may there be our generation forever.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Var olsun beyimiz, daim olsun neslimiz.
english: (Everyone's mouths) May there be our lord, may there be our generation forever.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Var olsun beyimiz, daim olsun neslimiz.
english: (Everyone's mouths) May there be our lord, may there be our generation forever.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Var olsun beyimiz, daim olsun neslimiz.
english: (Everyone's mouths) May there be our lord, may there be our generation forever.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Var olsun beyimiz, daim olsun neslimiz.
english: (Everyone's mouths) May there be our lord, may there be our generation forever.

text: İnşallah Allah bize o günleri de görmeyi nasip eder.
english: I hope God will give us a chance to see those days.
The land we have trodden is a cruel infidel...

text: ...onu kansız iş birlikçilerine teslim etmezsek olacaktır.
english: ...if we don't turn him over to bloodless associates.
To doubt this is to despair.
We give our lives, but we don't give up hope.

text: Türk balası kurt olur, bastığı yer yurt olur.
english: The turkey baby becomes a wolf, the place he steps on becomes a homeland.
If you have any questions, ask.

text: Eğer yoksa toy bittikten sonra herkes uykuya...
english: If not, then after the game is over, everyone's asleep...
...when it is pulled we will move for the raid.
It's very nice of you, Mr. Candar.
You've paid tribute to our Obama.
It's good to see you, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Tekrardan hoş gelmiş, toyumuzu şereflendirmişsiniz Candar Bey.
english: It's nice to meet you again, Mr. Candar. You've made our wedding a great honor.

text: O şeref bize ait Ertuğrul Bey.
english: That honor belongs to us, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Şimdi sıra geldi çıbanın başını almaya.
english: Now it's time to get the head of the nutcase.

text: Şu kız konuşmadı mı hâlâ? Bir haber bekledim ama.

english: I left the girl, Mr. Candar.
Excuse me, Mr. Ertuğrul, but why?
All he knows is what they told Mr. Aliyar.

text: At izi, it izine karıştı Ertuğrul Bey.
english: The horse's footprint, the dog's footprint, Mr. Ertuğrul.
We didn't know who to trust.

text: Her açılan kapıdan bir bela gelir.
english: Every door that opens, there's trouble.
Come on, Mr. Candar, let him come.
We'll be in trouble wherever it happens.

text: Beyim, Haçaturyan Usta sizinle görüşmek ister.
english: Sir, the Crusader Master wants to see you.
You're the one who orders it, sir.

text: Elimizde ne bir ipucu var, ne de bir tanık var Ertuğrul Bey'im.
english: We have no leads, no witnesses, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Aramızda yanlış anlaşılmalar olsa da söz konusu obalarımız ve varlığımızsa...
english: Even if there are misunderstandings between us, our villages and our existence...

text: ...sonuna kadar ardında olduğumuzu bilesin Ertuğrul Bey.
english: ...you know we're behind you to the end, Mr. Ertuğrul.
The Urals say it's right, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Biz bundan gayrı iki ayrı oba değiliz.
english: We're not two separate villages apart from that.

text: Ondan da öte kaygıları aynı olan bir aileyiz.
english: And more than that, we're a family with the same concerns.

text: Hayrola Haçaturyan Efendi, bir aksilik mi vardır?
english: Master Crusader, is there a problem?
Sir, I know you said don't come to the village.

text: Dere o kadar cömert çıktık ki...
english: We've been so generous with that...

text: ...bu kadar az vakitte bir kese doldurdum.
english: I filled a bag in such a short time.
But it's hard to protect gold.

text: Hem bu güzel haberi vereyim hem de altınları size teslim edeyim dedim.
english: I'm here to tell you the good news and hand over the gold.
May you be, Master of the Crusades.
(Sighs) You did good, you did good.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'im bu habere çok sevinecek.
english: My lord Ertuğrul will be very pleased to hear this.

text: Böyle giderse de sayende kesemiz altınla dolup taşacak inşallah.
english: If it goes this way, I hope we'll fill our bags with gold.

text: Aman beyim, Tanrı'nın yardımı sizlerin sayesinde.
english: Oh, my God, God help you.

text: Haçaturyan Usta, sen çalışmaya devam edesin.

english: Don't come to the village unless you have to.

text: Tez vakit azığını tamamlayıp, kimselere görünmeden madene geri dönesin.
english: You're gonna finish your early feed and go back to the mine without anyone noticing.

text: Sen hiç merak buyurma Artuk Bey'im.
english: Don't you ever wonder, Mr. Artuk.
We're almost back to our Obama, son.
We'll be out of cigarettes soon.
Who is the spy in the sultan's palace?

text: Belli ki sen benden daha heveslisin obaya dönmeye, ha?
english: You're obviously more eager to get back to the country than I am, huh?
This letter will get us back to the village.

text: Turgut konusunda sana ettiğim lafları hak etmedin.
english: You didn't deserve what I told you about Turgut.
You put a lot of work into him.
I wish I'd left him dead.
But first he will kill Ertuğrul.

text: Şimdi gidip Ertuğrul Bey'ime bir mesele olduğunu söyleyesin.
english: Now you go tell my lord Ertuğrul that there is a problem.
I need to see her soon.

text: Bu da babam Süleyman Şah'ın beylik kılıcı.
english: This is my father's sword, Suleiman Shah's.
The sword is not the one who made it...
...is valued by the hand that holds it.

text: Bu da babam Yinal Bey'den mirastır.
english: And that's a legacy from my father, Mr. Yinal.
I hope it stays with our sons.

text: Demek Süleyman Şah'ın Horasan'dan Şam'a kadar...
english: So from the Horasan to Damascus of Suleiman Shah...

text: ...kafire gök girip kızıl çıkan kılıcı budur.
english: ...the sword that comes out of the sky and turns red.
Do you have a minute, Mr. Ertuğrul?
The sword is a double-edged sword.

text: Çifte su yiyen demir pek olur, güçlü olur.

english: I've brought my sons up on this.

text: Toydan sonra müsait bir vakitte sizinle baş başa görüşmek isterim.
english: I'd like to see you in private after the wedding, if I can.
By Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
Praise be to God who has blessed our table.
(Abdurrahman) Do you have a record, sir?
Don't you know we have a guest, Abdurrahman?
I didn't mean to bother you, but...
Mr. Candar, if you'll excuse me.
I'm my brother, the lion. That's nice of you.
The spy at the palace of Sultan Alaeddin.
You did a good job, Turgut.
We'll raid the inn after the wedding.

text: Bunca zamandır bundan daha iyi haber işitmedim.
english: I haven't heard better news in so long.

text: Şimdi müsaadenle yokluğum fark edilmeden döneyim beyim.
english: Now, if you'll excuse me, I'll be back without being noticed, sir.

text: (Ertuğrul iç ses) Ebu Nakkaş'la görüştük. Niyeti açık.
Sultan Alaeddin'i ülkeyi yönetemez hale getirip, tahtı ele geçirmek.
english: To make Sultan Alaeddin incapable of governing the country and to seize the throne.

text: (Ertuğrul iç ses) Bunun için de kargaşaya, düzenin bozulmasına ihtiyacı var.
(Ertuğrul iç ses) Ertuğrul kendisine teslim ettiğim Amanda'yı konuşturunca...
english: (Erthogull whispers) When Ertugull makes Amanda speak, I have delivered her to him...
I can't even predict the end of the Urals.
It's a nice way to dig.
I'm sorry, Mr. Candar, but I'm not going to be able to do this.

text: (Candar) Bundan böyle toyumuz da, düğünümüz de...
english: (Candar) From now on, our wedding and our wedding...
...we will always have the same plan, Mr. Ertuğrul.
You are a man of great power!
You are a man of great power!
